org.genepattern.io
Class IOUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.genepattern.io.IOUtil

public class IOUtil
extends java.lang.Object

A class containing static convenience methods for reading and writing data.

getBaseFileName

public static java.lang.String getBaseFileName(java.lang.String filepath)
Gets the base file name. For example, if filepath is 'test.txt' the method returns 'test'.

Parameters:
filepath - The file path.
Returns:
The base file name.

Returns:

getDatasetParser

public static DatasetParser getDatasetParser(java.lang.String pathname,
                                             boolean tryAll)
Gets a data reader that can read the document at the given pathname or null if no reader is found.

Parameters:
pathname - A pathname string
tryAll - whether to try all readers if the type of the document can not be deduced from the file extension
Returns:
The reader

getDatasetWriterByFormatName

public static DatasetWriter getDatasetWriterByFormatName(java.lang.String formatName)
Returns a DatasetWriter that can encode the named format

Parameters:
formatName - a String containing the informal name of a format (e.g., "res" or "gct".
Returns:
a DatasetWriter that can encode in the specified format or null if no such DatasetWriter exists.

filepath - The file path.

getOdfModelType

public static java.lang.String getOdfModelType(java.io.InputStream is)
Returns the model type of an odf file. The input stream is closed.

Parameters:
is - An input stream to an odf file
Returns:
the odf module type or the empty string if unable to determine the model

                                           DatasetCreator<?> datasetCreator)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           ParseException
Reads the dataset at the given pathname. The type of the returned object is determined by the datasetCreator argument.

Parameters:
pathname - The file pathname
datasetCreator - The data creator
Returns:
An object containing the data
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the file
ParseException - If there is a problem with the data

readDataset

public static DefaultDataset readDataset(java.lang.String filename,
                                         java.io.InputStream is)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         ParseException
Reads the data at the given input stream and returns a new DefaultDataset instance.

Parameters:
filename - The filename. The filename extension is used to deduce the type of document at the given input stream
is - The input stream. The stream should be closed by the caller.
Returns:
An DefaultDataset instance
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the file
ParseException - If there is a problem with the data

is - The input stream. The stream should be closed by the caller.
Returns:
An Dataset instance

ParseException - If there is a problem with the data

writeCls

public static java.lang.String writeCls(ClassVector cv,
                                        java.lang.String pathname,
                                        boolean checkFileExtension)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Writes the given class vector to a file

Parameters:
cv - The class vector
pathname - A pathname string
checkFileExtension - Whether the correct file extension will be added to the pathname if it is not present.
Returns:
The pathname that the data was saved to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while saving the data

writeDataset

public static java.lang.String writeDataset(Dataset data,
                                            java.lang.String formatName,
                                            java.lang.String pathname,
                                            boolean checkFileExtension)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes data to a file in the given format. The correct file extension will be added to the pathname if it is not present. If there is already a file present at the given pathname, its contents are discarded.

Parameters:
data - the data.
formatName - a String containing the informal name of a format (e.g., "res" or "gct".)
pathname - a pathname string
checkFileExtension - Whether the correct file extension will be added to the pathname if it is not present.
Returns:
The pathname that the data was saved to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while saving the data

writeFeatureList

public static void writeFeatureList(java.lang.String[] features,
                                    java.lang.String pathname)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Writes the given feature list to a file

Parameters:
features - The features
pathname - A pathname string
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an error occurs while saving the data
